trans-unit.source: Represents a customized view of a <xref href="System.Data.DataRow"></xref>.
Whenever data is displayed, such as in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> control, only one version of each row can be displayed.
The displayed row is a <xref:System.Data.DataRowView>.
A <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> can have one of four different version states: `Default`, `Original`, `Current`, and `Proposed`.
After invoking <xref:System.Data.DataRow.BeginEdit%2A> on a <xref:System.Data.DataRow>, any edited value becomes the `Proposed` value.
Until either <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.CancelEdit%2A> or <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.EndEdit%2A> is invoked, the row has an `Original` and a `Proposed` version.
If <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.CancelEdit%2A> is invoked, the proposed version is discarded, and the value reverts to `Original`.
If <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.EndEdit%2A> is invoked, the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> no longer has a `Proposed` version; instead, the proposed value becomes the current value.
Default values are available only on rows that have columns with default values defined.
Begins an edit procedure.
Use <xref:System.Data.DataView.AddNew%2A> to add a <xref:System.Data.DataRowView>.
The <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.BeginEdit%2A> method is identical to the <xref:System.Data.DataRow.BeginEdit%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method of the <xref:System.Data.DataRow>.
After calling <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.BeginEdit%2A>, any changes made to the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> can be rolled back by calling <xref:System.Data.DataRow.CancelEdit%2A>.
Call the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.BeginEdit%2A> method before allowing users to change row values.
After values have been changed, you retrieve the new values by setting the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.RowVersion%2A> to `DataRowVersion.Proposed`.

Check the values with a business rule, and roll back the changes if needed by calling <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.CancelEdit%2A>, or call <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.EndEdit%2A> to accept the changes.
Cancels an edit procedure.
After calling <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.CancelEdit%2A>, all changes to the row are rolled back.
You can also roll back changes by calling <xref:System.Data.DataTable.RejectChanges%2A> on the parent <xref:System.Data.DataTable>.
Returns a <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> for the child <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> with the specified child <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> object.
a <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> for the child <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>.
Returns a <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> for the child <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> with the specified child <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> name.
A string containing the <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> name.
a <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> for the child <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>.
Returns a <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> for the child <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> with the specified <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> and parent..
The <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> object.
The parent object.
A <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> for the child <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>.
Returns a <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> for the child <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> with the specified <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> name and parent.
A string containing the <xref href="System.Data.DataRelation"></xref> name.
The parent
a <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> for the child <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> to which this row belongs.
The `DataView` to which this row belongs.
Deletes a row.
The row is not permanently deleted until <xref:System.Data.DataTable.AcceptChanges%2A> is invoked on the <xref:System.Data.DataTable> that the row belongs to.
A <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> may be invalid when a `DataRow` is deleted from the underlying table.

When the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> becomes invalid, operations that access values associated with <xref:System.Data.DataRowView%2C> such as <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.Delete%2A>, throw an exception.
Commits changes to the underlying <xref href="System.Data.DataRow"></xref> and ends the editing session that was begun with <xref href="System.Data.DataRowView.BeginEdit"></xref>.
Use <xref href="System.Data.DataRowView.CancelEdit"></xref> to discard the changes made to the <xref href="System.Data.DataRow"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the current <xref href="System.Data.DataRowView"></xref> is identical to the specified object.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to be compared.
`true` if object is a and it returns the same row as the current ; otherwise `false`.
Returns the hash code of the <xref href="System.Data.DataRow"></xref> object.
A 32-bit signed integer hash code 1, which represents Boolean `true` if the value of this instance is nonzero; otherwise the integer zero, which represents Boolean `false`.
Indicates whether the row is in edit mode.
`true` if the row is in edit mode; otherwise `false`.
Indicates whether a <xref href="System.Data.DataRowView"></xref> is new.
After you call you call <xref:System.Data.DataView.AddNew%2A>, <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.IsNew%2A> will be true for the returned <xref:System.Data.DataRowView>.

<xref:System.Data.DataRowView.IsNew%2A> will be true until either <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.EndEdit%2A> is called on the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView>, or <xref:System.Data.DataView.AddNew%2A> is called again.
(There is only one new row.)
`true` if the row is new; otherwise `false`.
Gets or sets a value in a specified column.
The specified column.
The value of the column.
Gets or sets a value in a specified column.
String that contains the specified column.
The value of the column.
Event that is raised when a <xref href="System.Data.DataRowView"></xref> property is changed.
This event fires when the column value associated with the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> changes.
This change does not cause the associated index position of the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> to be changed.
Gets the <xref href="System.Data.DataRow"></xref> being viewed.
The <xref href="System.Data.DataRow"></xref> being viewed by the <xref href="System.Data.DataRowView"></xref>.
Gets the current version description of the <xref href="System.Data.DataRow"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Data.DataView.RowStateFilter%2A> property specifies both <xref:System.Data.DataRowState> and <xref:System.Data.DataRowVersion> settings.
For more information, see <xref:System.Data.DataRowState>, <xref:System.Data.DataRowVersion>, and <xref:System.Data.DataViewRowState>.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.DataRowVersion"></xref> values.
Possible values for the <xref href="System.Data.DataRowView.RowVersion"></xref> property are `Default`, `Original`, `Current`, and `Proposed`.
Returns a collection of custom attributes for this instance of a component.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
An AttributeCollection containing the attributes for this object.
Returns the class name of this instance of a component.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
The class name of this instance of a component.
Returns the name of this instance of a component.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
The name of this instance of a component.
Returns a type converter for this instance of a component.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
The type converter for this instance of a component.
Returns the default event for this instance of a component.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
The default event for this instance of a component.
Returns the default property for this instance of a component.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
The default property for this instance of a component.
Returns an editor of the specified type for this instance of a component.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that represents the editor for this object.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> of the specified type that is the editor for this object, or `null` if the editor cannot be found.
Returns the events for this instance of a component.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
The events for this instance of a component.
Returns the events for this instance of a component with specified attributes.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
The attributes
The events for this instance of a component.
Returns the properties for this instance of a component.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
The properties for this instance of a component.
Returns the properties for this instance of a component with specified attributes.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
The attributes.
The properties for this instance of a component.
Returns an object that contains the property described by the specified property descriptor.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor"></xref> that represents the property whose owner is to be found.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the owner of the specified property.
Gets a message that describes any validation errors for the object.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IDataErrorInfo> interface.
The validation error on the object.
Gets the error message for the property with the given name.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IDataErrorInfo> interface.
The name of the property whose error message to get.
The error message for the property.
The default is an empty string ("").
